intro: Physalis gracilis, commonly known as the common groundcherries or the husk tomato, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its hairy stems and oval, yellowish-green leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, orange-red berries enclosed in a papery husk, which are edible when ripe. It thrives in temperate climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value and edible fruits. Physalis gracilis is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
